SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Cruise Ships relative to Desert Camps?
SRP.A: Cruise Ships is {below} Desert Camps in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total average room price?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Cruise Ships}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total average room price?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Desert Camps}.

VE.A: Desert Camps's average room price in 1969 is {85.93} $.

VE.Q: What are the average room price of Cruise Ships, Beachfront Villas, and Desert Camps in 1962?

SC.Q: What is the average total Average Room Price?

NC.Q: Between 1963 and 1970, was the average total Average Room Price higher or lower than between 1967 and 1969?
NC.A: The average total average room price between 1963 and 1970 was {higher} than between 1967 and 1969.

NC.Q: Between 1961 and 1973, was the average total Average Room Price higher or lower than between 1970 and 1974?
NC.A: The average total average room price between 1961 and 1973 was {higher} than between 1970 and 1974.

NC.Q: Between 1967 and 1974, did the total Average Room Price experience a larger or smaller change than between 1965 and 1974?
NC.A: The change in total average room price between 1967 and 1974 was {smaller} than between 1965 and 1974.

NC.Q: Was the total Average Room Price in 1967 higher or lower than in 1973?
NC.A: The total average room price in 1967 was {higher} than in 1973.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Cruise Ships} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Desert Camps, Beachfront Villas, Cruise Ships}.
